one_liner: This technique integrates various machine vision methods to enhance the diagnosis of plant diseases using visual data.
how_it_works: The Multimodal Fusion Framework captures images of cotton leaves and processes them to extract relevant features. It combines features from different modalities to improve the accuracy of diagnosing the Cotton Leaf Curl Virus (CLCuV). A classification algorithm is then applied to determine the presence or absence of the virus based on the fused features.

steps: 1. Capture images of cotton leaves using a camera.
2. Preprocess the images to enhance features.
3. Extract relevant features from the images using machine vision techniques.
4. Fuse the features from different modalities.
5. Apply a classification algorithm to diagnose the presence of CLCuV.
algorithm.output_format: Diagnosis result indicating presence or absence of CLCuV.

avoid_when: Real-time diagnosis is required with minimal processing.

implementation_skeleton:
def multimodal_fusion(images: List[Image]) -> str:
    preprocessed_images = preprocess_images(images)
    features = extract_features(preprocessed_images)
    fused_features = fuse_features(features)
    diagnosis = classify(fused_features)
    return diagnosis
common_mistakes: Neglecting to preprocess images, leading to poor feature extraction.
Overfitting the classification model to training data.
